name: Dumai Dunai
description:
Slavic dub-punk missionaries Dumai Dunai have been winning the hearts of audiences all over the world since they first burst onto the scene in 2022. 

With members from Ukraine, Bulgaria, and Canada, the multi-lingual seven-piece combines the deep grooves of dub with the energy of punk rock, the raw ecstasy of the blasting horns of Balkan wedding brass bands, and the joys and sorrows of Ukrainian village polyphony.

Their debut album "Sometime Between Now and Never," released in June 2024, receiving excellent reviews and a nomination for Global Roots Album of the Year from the Canadian Folk Music Awards.

name: Toronto's Santa Claus Parade Exhibition
description:
Relive the moments that have made Toronto's Santa Claus Parade a beloved celebration for more than 120 years. From its humble beginnings in 1905 — when a single float carried Santa from Union Station to Eaton's — to the dazzling televised spectacle it is today, the parade has brought generations joy, hope and imagination. 

Whether you grew up watching from the curb or tuning in from home, this nostalgic exhibition invites you to experience the enduring magic of Toronto's most treasured holiday event through striking images from the City of Toronto Archives, captured by photographers John H. Boyd, Harvey R. Naylor, Dorothy Skinner, Paul Till and Avard Woolaver.

name: Tunes & Tales: Debt Dreams & Kesha Christie
description:
Embark on a colourful journey every Friday at Old City Hall, where musicians perform from the grand staircase and storytellers fill the council chamber with lively tales that celebrate Toronto's vibrant cultural mosaic. Enjoy soulful tunes, festive melodies and stirring stories with a global flavour that capture the magic of the season. 

This event features catchy, genre-blending sounds by Debt Dreams and storytelling by Kesha Christie, who brings stories to life with warmth, insight and unforgettable energy.

name: Trixx and Friends

location.name: The Fleck at Harbourfront Centre Theatre

description:
Get ready to laugh, Toronto! 

We're bringing some of North America's top comedic talent, Trixx, Paris Sashay, Schoen Favorite and Jay Reid to the stage for two nights of stand-up that will have you laughing until it hurts. 

From sharp-witted storytelling to boundary-pushing social commentary, these comics deliver comedy that's bold, brilliant and hilarious.

name: Double Dixit: Lotti and Handel

location.name: Jeanne Lamon Hall, Trinity-St. Paul's Centre

description:
The Tafelmusik Chamber Choir joins the orchestra in exploring settings of the Latin text for Psalm 110 by Lotti and Handel, in a program curated by Choir Director Ivars Taurins. 

The Venetian Antonio Lotti was admired for the expressive contrasts and fluid vocal lines in his music, which clearly influenced the young Handel when he arrived in Italy, inspiring him to unleash his creative vigour in his powerful and dramatic setting of Dixit Dominus.

Tafelmusik Chamber Choir has been praised for its clarity, nuance, and brilliance, qualities that enhance the many textures of this choral program. 

"There's something quite magical in the perfect blending of the different voices, soothing, ethereal yet incisive and quicksilver when needed" says Ludwig van Toronto.

name: Angie Hilts and Dan Mock
description:
Having met 12 years ago playing in the house band on Bob Dylan's 72nd birthday at The El Mocambo, Angie and Dan quickly discovered they shared a love of harmony singing and songwriting. Years later the two of them would meet again singing behind great Canadian-songwriter Jerry Leger on many of his records and bandstands.

This time, they will be joined by Adam Beer-Colacino on guitar and together will play two sets of originals, blues, folk, and century old classics from the great North American songbook.

name: Skate by the Lake
description:
Is there anything more magical than gliding across the ice under the open winter sky by the waterfront? Our beloved community skating rink returns, bigger, brighter, and ready to welcome more of our community than ever before.

This year our expanded rink offers even more space for families, friends, and kids of all ages to experience the joy of skating, laughter, and winter fun together by the water.

name: Thrive Toronto
description:
Where culture and community meet! 

We're amplifying Indo-Caribbean voices through visual art, live performances, film, and community gatherings. Following the success of Thrive Brooklyn in NYC, we're bringing together Toronto-based artists, writers, and audiences to celebrate identity, resilience, and creativity.

Each day will offer something different, come join us!

name: Winterfest
description:
Back for its second year, we're transforming a festive wonderland. 

Enjoy dazzling lights, delicious eats, magical train rides, holiday markets, a new Winter Maze and live performances. Make sure you add this to your list of festive activities to do this season!

name: Athina Malli
description:
"From Smyrna with Love" is a musical tribute to a legendary community, our lost homeland, long gone but never forgotten. 

Together, with an exceptional group of musicians we are excited to present the rich and colorful musical culture of the Greeks of Asia Minor, the so-called Cafe-Amans or Anatolian Taverns. 

Come and listen to the enchanting music of Smyrna and dance to their sensual rythms like tsifteteli and karsilama. Tune in to their intricate melodies and feel the way our ancenstors celebrated love and life through music and dance! Hear the Turkish, Armenian and Jewish cultural influences in our music. It will be an unforgetable night filled joy, nostalgia, lots of singing and dancing!

name: The Jitters
description:
They ride again! 

The band that formed in Toronto in 1981(and allegedly broke up ten years later) continues to occasionally get together and make music. 

Last seen performing live in 2019, Blair, Danny, Matt and David are still the rocking pop band they've always been. In the 80s, the band opened for The Kinks, The Byrds, Huey Lewis and the News, Colin James and more. March 1988 saw them support Heart in the UK, closing off the tour with three sold-out nights at Wembley Arena where the band received standing ovations. 

Their song, "Last of the Red Hot Fools" not only became a Top Twenty single in Canada, but it even broke into the BBC's Hot 100.

name: Soweto Gospel Choir: Peace

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
The multi-Grammy and Emmy Award-winning vocal ensemble returns to perform a joyful program of South African freedom songs, traditional spirituals, and some classics, featuring the spirited music of Aretha Franklin, Harry Belafonte, Peter Gabriel, Kate Bush, Leonard Cohen, and more!

Formed in 2002, the Choir was created to celebrate the unique power of African gospel music and quickly established itself as a group that is "undeniably synchronized, appears unshakable, and simultaneously expresses universality and individuality" (San Francisco Classical Voice). Heralded by Nelson Mandela, Desmond Tutu, Barack Obama, and Oprah Winfrey, Soweto Gospel Choir excites audiences worldwide, uplifting the soul and spreading joy through its earthy rhythms, rich harmonies, brilliant costumes, and infectious spirit.

"Absolutely thrilling singers ... dazzling music." (Billboard)

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music.

name: Old Town Toronto Cavalcade Of Lights
description:
Presented on behalf of our local businesses come kick-off the holiday season with lights and live music in Berczy Park, known for its beloved fountain featuring dogs and one saucy feline. 

Come enjoy a whimsical holiday light display perfect for an Insta-worthy memorable experience.
